      • build

        public OracleDocument build()
                     throws OracleException
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Builds a JSON object containing the collection metadata. An OracleException will be raised if an invalid configuration is detected. The specific validation errors that may occur are documented throughout this interface.
        Specified by:
        build in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Returns:
        The JSON collection metadata encoded as UTF-8
        Throws:
        OracleException - if an invalid combination is detected
        See Also:
        OracleDatabaseAdmin.createCollection(String, OracleDocument)

      • schemaName

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder schemaName​(String schemaName)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the SQL schema name for the underlying database object. If schemaName is null, the schema associated with the connection will be used.
        Specified by:
        schemaName in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        schemaName - the name of the schema or null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object

      • tableName

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder tableName​(String tableName)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the SQL table name. A collection is based off of a table or a view. Calling this method will override the view name if previously set using OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.viewName(String). If tableName is null, the collection will be created using a table name based on the name of the collection name.
        Specified by:
        tableName in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.viewName(String)

      • viewName

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder viewName​(String viewName)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the SQL view name. A collection is based off of a table or a view. Calling this method will override the table name if previously set using OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.tableName(String) If viewName is null, the collection will be created using a table name based on the name of the collection name.
        Specified by:
        viewName in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        viewName - the name of the view. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.tableName(String)

      • contentColumnName

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder contentColumnName​(String name)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the name of the content column. If name is null, the default value "JSON_DOCUMENT" is used.
        Specified by:
        contentColumnName in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the column. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object

      • contentColumnType

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder contentColumnType​(String sqlType)
                                               throws OracleException
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the SQL type of the content column. The value must be either "VARCHAR2", "NVARCHAR2", "RAW", "BLOB", "CLOB", or "NCLOB". If sqlType is null, the default value "BLOB" is used.

        Changing the content column type may automatically remove other related settings:

        • Setting to LOB type will remove the content column maximum length.
        • Setting to a non-LOB type will remove all SecureFile LOB settings.
        Specified by:
        contentColumnType in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        sqlType - the type of the content column. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        OracleException - if sqlType is not one of the expected values

      • contentColumnMaxLength

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder contentColumnMaxLength​(int maxLength)
                                                    throws OracleException
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the maximum length of the content column. If maxLength is 0, then the maximum is unspecified and the default value of 2000 will be used, if applicable. If the content column type is a LOB type and a maximum length is specified, an error will be raised when OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.build() is called.
        Specified by:
        contentColumnMaxLength in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        maxLength - the maximum size
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        OracleException - if maxLength is negative
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.contentColumnType(String)

      • contentColumnValidation

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder contentColumnValidation​(String mode)
                                                     throws OracleException
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the validation mode for the content column. The value of validation must be one of "STANDARD", "STRICT", or "LAX". If validation is null, the default "STANDARD" mode is used.
        Specified by:
        contentColumnValidation in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        mode - the validation mode. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object.
        Throws:
        OracleException - if validation is not null, "STANDARD", "STRICT", or "LAX"

      • contentColumnCompress

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder contentColumnCompress​(String compress)
                                                   throws OracleException
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the SecureFiles LOB compress setting for the content column. The value of compress must be one of "NONE", "HIGH", "MEDIUM", or "LOW". This setting is not applicable if the content column type is not a LOB type. If compress is null, the default value "NONE" is used.

        If the compression is set to something other than "NONE" and the column is not a LOB type, an error will be raised when OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.build() is called.

        Specified by:
        contentColumnCompress in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        compress - the compression mode. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        OracleException - if compress is not one of the expected values
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.contentColumnType(String)

      • contentColumnCache

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder contentColumnCache​(boolean cache)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the SecureFiles LOB cache setting for the content column. This setting is not applicable if the content column type is not a LOB type. The default value is true.

        If the cache is true and the column is not a LOB type, an error will be raised when OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.build() is called.

        Specified by:
        contentColumnCache in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        cache - specifies if caching is used
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.contentColumnType(String)

      • contentColumnEncrypt

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder contentColumnEncrypt​(String encrypt)
                                                  throws OracleException
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the SecureFiles LOB encryption setting for the content column. The value of encrypt must be "NONE", "3DES168", "AES128", "AES192", "AES256". If encrypt is null, the default value "NONE" is used. This setting is not applicable if the content column type is not a LOB type. If encrypt is anything other than "NONE" and the column is not a LOB type, an error will be raised when OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.build() is called.
        Specified by:
        contentColumnEncrypt in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        encrypt - the encryption type. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        OracleException - if encrypt is not one of the expected values
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.contentColumnType(String)

      • keyColumnName

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder keyColumnName​(String name)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the name of the key column. If name is null, they default value "ID" is used.
        Specified by:
        keyColumnName in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the key column. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object

      • keyColumnType

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder keyColumnType​(String ktype)
                                           throws OracleException
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the key column type. The value of sqlType must be one of "VARCHAR2", "NVARCHAR2", "NUMBER", or "RAW". If sqlType is null, the default value "VARCHAR2" will be used. Setting the key column type to "NUMBER" or "RAW" automatically removes the maximum size of the key column.
        Specified by:
        keyColumnType in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        ktype - the key column type. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        OracleException - if sqlType is not one of the expected values.

      • keyColumnMaxLength

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder keyColumnMaxLength​(int maxLength)
                                                throws OracleException
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the maximum size of the key column. If maxLength is 0, then the maximum is unspecified and the default value of 255 will be used, if applicable. If the key column type is NUMBER or RAW and a maximum length is specified, an error will be raised when OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.build() is called.
        Specified by:
        keyColumnMaxLength in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        maxLength - the maximum size
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        OracleException - if maxLength is negative
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.keyColumnType(String)

      • keyColumnPath

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder keyColumnPath​(String path)
                                           throws OracleException
        Throws:
        OracleException

      • keyColumnAssignmentMethod

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder keyColumnAssignmentMethod​(String method)
                                                       throws OracleException
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the key column assignment method. The value of assignmentMethod must be one of "SEQUENCE", "GUID", "UUID", or "CLIENT". If assignmentMethod is null, the default value "UUID" will be used. If assignmentMethod is anything other than "SEQUENCE", the key column sequence name will be automatically removed. If the assignment method is "SEQUENCE" but no key column sequence name is specified, an error will be raised when OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.build() is called.
        Specified by:
        keyColumnAssignmentMethod in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        method - the key column assignment method. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        OracleException - if assignmentMethod is not one of the expected values
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.keyColumnSequenceName(String)

      • keyColumnSequenceName

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder keyColumnSequenceName​(String sequenceName)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the sequence name for sequence-based keys. If sequenceName is null, the sequence name is unspecified. Specifying a sequence name automatically changes the key column assignment method to "SEQUENCE".
        Specified by:
        keyColumnSequenceName in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        sequenceName - the name of the sequence. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.keyColumnAssignmentMethod(String)

      • creationTimeColumnName

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder creationTimeColumnName​(String name)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the optional creation time column name. If name is null, no creation time column will be used. The default value is "CREATED_ON".
        Specified by:
        creationTimeColumnName in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the column. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object

      • lastModifiedColumnName

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder lastModifiedColumnName​(String name)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the optional last-modified timestamp column name. If name is null, no last-modified column will be used and the last-modified column index will automatically be removed. The default value is "LAST_MODIFIED".
        Specified by:
        lastModifiedColumnName in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the column. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.lastModifiedColumnIndex(String)

      • lastModifiedColumnIndex

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder lastModifiedColumnIndex​(String index)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the last-modified column index name. If index is null, the index name is unspecified. If the last-modified index name is specified but the last-modified column name is not set, an error will be raised when OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.build() is called.
        Specified by:
        lastModifiedColumnIndex in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        index - the name of the index. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.lastModifiedColumnName(String)

      • versionColumnName

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder versionColumnName​(String name)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the version (ETag) column name. If name is null, the version column will not be used and the version column method will automatically set to "NONE". The default value is "VERSION".
        Specified by:
        versionColumnName in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the column. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        See Also:
        OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.versionColumnMethod(String)

      • versionColumnMethod

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder versionColumnMethod​(String method)
                                                 throws OracleException
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets version column method. The value of method must be "SEQUENTIAL", "TIMESTAMP", "UUID", "SHA256", "MD5", or "NONE". If method is null, the default value "NONE" is used. If the version column method is not "NONE" and the version column name is not specified, an error will be raised when OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.build() is called.
        Specified by:
        versionColumnMethod in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        method - the version method. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object
        Throws:
        OracleException - if method is not one of the expected values

      • mediaTypeColumnName

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder mediaTypeColumnName​(String name)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the media type column name. If name is null, the media type column is unspecified and a media type column will not be used. If the content column type is not "BLOB" and the media type column is specified, an error will be raised when OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder.build() is called. By default, the media type column is unspecified.
        Specified by:
        mediaTypeColumnName in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the media type column. May be null
        Returns:
        a reference to this object

      • readOnly

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder readOnly​(boolean readOnly)
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Sets the read/write policy. The default value is false.
        Specified by:
        readOnly in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Parameters:
        readOnly - when true, specifies the collection is read only
        Returns:
        a reference to this object

      • jsonFormat

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder jsonFormat​(String format)

      • removeOptionalColumns

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder removeOptionalColumns()
        Description copied from interface: OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Removes the optional metadata columns. This method is useful when creating a collection over an existing table where these columns may not exist.

        Calling this method is equivalent to the following: 

           this
    .creationTimeColumnName(null)
    .lastModifiedColumnName(null)
    .versionColumnName(null)
    .mediaTypeColumnName(null);
        Specified by:
        removeOptionalColumns in interface OracleRDBMSMetadataBuilder
        Returns:
        a reference to this object

      • setNative

        public CollectionDescriptor.Builder setNative​(boolean v)
